author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Federation of Tamil Nadu Noon Meal and Anganwadi Workers’ Associations is planning to stage a protest in front of Chennai Collectorate on January 21.

The federation’s demands include a separate department for the nutritious meal scheme and rules to be framed for anganwadi (children’s centres) and noon-meal workers, a press release said.

They have also asked for an increase in their pension and medical insurance for former employees. All vacancies should be filled as per seniority on the basis of educational qualifications and those who had finished their teacher-training should be given teachers’ posts.

The federation has also asked for an increase in the allocation for eggs from 8 paise to 25 paise and for them to be supplied directly to the centres.
title: Anganwadi employees to stage protest
